snippet: A sergeant dismissed by the California Highway Patrol apparently killed himself a month after he was arrested on charges that he had raped a woman in his cruiser, the authorities said today.         Two joggers found the sergeant, James W. Pitsor,...
lead_paragraph: A sergeant dismissed by the California Highway Patrol apparently killed himself a month after he was arrested on charges that he had raped a woman in his cruiser, the authorities said today. Two joggers found the sergeant, James W. Pitsor, 49, on a dirt road about 5 P.M. on Wednesday, said a spokesman for the San Bernardino County Sheriff's Department, Tom Neely. Sergeant Pitsor apparently shot himself, the authorities said. Foul play was not indicated. The Desert Dispatch of Barstow, quoting police officers it did not name, said the trooper had used a rifle.

headline.main: Trooper Charged With Rape Kills Himself
